equal.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else
equal.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Both candidates received an equal number of votes.
They believe that all work is of equal value.
The two towns are roughly equal in size.
The rent was equal to half his monthly income.
equal.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: having the same rights, opportunities etc as everyone else, whatever your race, religion, or sex
equal.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Our constitution states that all men are equal.
Our education system should provide equal opportunities for all children.
The government is committed to achieving equal rights for women.
equal.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else
equal.translation[0].note_box[0].section: The food is shared out in exactly equal portions among all members of the community.
The number of buyers and sellers must be roughly equal before trading begins.
They are about equal in height and weight.
Both candidates received an equal number of votes.
Draw two lines of equal length.
The population of each town is roughly equal in size.
Your pension will be equal in value to two thirds of your final year salary.
In higher education, women are equal in numbers to men.
He is remembered for his novels, but his scientific work is of equal importance.
equal.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: having the same rights, opportunities etc as everyone else, whatever your race, religion, or sex
equal.translation[0].note_box[1].section: In many countries, women do not have equal rights with men.
The government must make sure that all children have equal opportunities in education.
The workers’ demands include equal pay for equal work.
The law states that disabled people must have equal access to employment.
Everyone should get equal treatment under the law.
It is a myth that all men are born equal.
They believe that everyone is created equal by God.
equal.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else
equal.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Prices become more stable when supply equals demand.
equal.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to be as good as something else, or get to the same standard as someone or something else
equal.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to produce a particular result or effect
equal.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: A highly-trained workforce equals high productivity.
equal.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: someone who is as important, intelligent etc as you are, or who has the same rights and opportunities as you do
equal.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: He treats all his staff as equals.
She wasn’t his equal in intelligence.
